but to be clear, we all think the cake is a lie right?
{{champion:223}} I have cake, anyone care to make a bargain :}
Props for using the Sith code in a League spin. I was trying to find some way to incorporate it but you nailed it. =3
You forgot the last line, the last one is I deserve challenjour, gg

As AMAZING as this is for riot to give the players the information to better there game, with them removing purchasable green wards from the shop, this lesson is a bit pointless. With that in mind I'd Love more consumable content like this in the future, like summoner spell choice, or CS'ing numbers, ect!

Really? if anything I think it's them trying to explain the decision to remove stealth wards from the game, because, as they mentioned above 64% of people never bought a ward, and it's not even until you get to master tier where the avg amount of stealth wards purchased is greater than 2!

Because no one was buying wards anyway, why not just get rid of the item and give players ways to ward that they will actually use?
they did. they gave us the free trinket to start and then the option to upgrade it into a mini sightstone for 250g and people still didnt have the IQ to buy a fucking ward.{{summoner:4}}

I wanna kill my team when its 30+ mins into the game and they still have regular stealth trinket.  The upgraded one is amazing you can have 3 wards out at once it's almost as good as a sightstone.  I feel the same about people who never buy pink wards.

Yea, Yellow Trinket is actually far more powerful than Sightstone honestly.  If you are not returning to base every 4th minute on the dot, at least, Yellow upgrade gives far more vision power.  The only advantage SS has is that it lets you also stack up with a Sweeper to boot.  And as a jungle main, I honestly tend to prefer the vision power from wards to grabbing a Sweep, just because I tend to need to get that vision control out, and can use Rapts as a short term oracle, or one of the several pinks I buy per game. (I often get 2-3 pinks, specially if they are clearing them fairly often.).  Sadly enough, I've outwarded supports fairly often with my trinket, which tends to stay on CD for most of the game.  About the only time it isn't on CD is when I already have 3 wards out and don't need to move one of them.
I cant stress how true this is tho.

If you've played PBE you'll realize that the vision changes are actually for the better. Feels like a lot of people are getting the wrong idea, this is simply a representation of vision. They are trying to get people to realize that vision is a key component in winning games, therefore it is not pointless.
they're not removing trinkets though

I would have liked to know whether trinket wards counted towards wards purchased. My gut says if Sightstone didn't, yellow trinket didn't either. Also would have been nice to see wards placed instead of simply wards bought.

"I hate this article."
{{champion:56}}
That awkward moment where you buy/place more wards than the entire enemy team combined... I don't know how many times I've had this happen and I'm a top lane main. {{item:3070}}
That's sad that your support places less wards than you. As a support main, I eagerly hope to oppose those types.

As a support main as well, That's the first thing I check at score screens. Click advanced and look at wards placed. 99% of the time I place more than the other support, ~40%ish of the time I'll outward their whole team -_-

As a person who mains the role "Fill," and so typically ends up on Support, I normally end up warding more than both the enemy team AND my own team... combined. >>

Even when I'm not on Support, I ward more than most people at my tier. It's a strange feeling when you're on Jungle and the first thing you back for is the jg item upgrade, three green wards, a pink, and a few HP pots...

I played a game on blue side as the adc and on my first back I bought a bf sword and a pink ward. When I got back to lane I shoved the wave and walked into the enemy team's blue buff area and put said ward in the bush. I had a support main and they cried from happiness.
as a support main, I have heard tale of your heroic deeds but thought them only myth
More people should be like you.  First back BF and pink ward = beauty.

I do the same thing when i play ADC. But i main Supp, and my second role is Jungler. So i'm use to getting Wards for days.

It surprises me if in a game, the ADC actually wards 3 times, even more so if the ADC actually buys a Ward or two =).

If i have more than enough for BF and a Vision Ward, that's what i buy. Otherwise, i die a little inside and just get BF XD.

As Supp, the cliche-iest thing ever, Sightstone, Vision Ward, Lens.

As Jungler, i get my Jg item stuff, and use a little bit of the rest to get some wards and boots. Then finish jg item, get more wards. Then after Jg item, get Sightstone! And you know what is hilarious, you'd be surprised at the number of people that actually complain when a Jg gets several wards or Sightstone. And these people also complain about lack of warding, when i ward the areas i have to ward, but they rarely ward anything ^_^.

While this is great information communication can still be quite difficult in League. (Typing can lead to death if done in the wrong place) So maybe could we have a set of "warded" and "ward here" pings?
This is a great idea!
"But Wards don't give Damage"- Jinx

This is a really informative piece. In fact, I'd say it **swept** me off of my feet. If I was able to, I'd give you an a**ward.** However, I can't, as the **orb**ligatory awards ceremony for informing people already passed. I'm sorry if you're **s**crying because of it, it really is a shame. Nevertheless, you've put a whole new perspective into the **lens**es of your players. Thanks, Riot!

As a fellow analyst, this is a really great post. I know I'm very irresponsible at upgrading my trinket as a jungler (or getting a scanner in general) so I'll do my best to do that more going forward :D
Riot: We're removing green wards. HERE'S A PIECE OF INFORMATION ON HOW TO USE A WARD.
I honestly think you guys should write more articles like this explaining how to play the game and adapt to the meta better and compare through different roles and tiers.
I wish people would upgrade trinkets. :(
But... Wards don't do damage.
they do when you get a pick from them

so... what about sightstones?  If you get a 'stone, your ward purchases will naturally be lower.  I know when I'm playing support, I often lead in wards placed, even if I don't lead in wards purchased.
But we now are removing stealth wards haha take that!!
Even with them removing stealth wards, there is still the totem trinket and the upgrade is so efficient you almost never need to buy more stealth wards post lvl 9.
Why buy wards when I can buy a couple health pots and survive the ganks that are coming at me?
